It lacks the startling epiphany of August's The November Man and the high caliber of acting from a certain Denzel Washington in The Equalizer. However, it's much more focused and assured than the totally discombobulated 3 Days to Kill (the weakest of the four).

For the most part, John Wick is a silly, ludicrous picture that doesn't really add anything new or reinvent the wheel via the revenge thriller genre. Its look is mirrorball glitter and glitz and its style is reminiscent of a Hong Kong action extravaganza (but with less "Kong" and tons of "ganza"). This is a vehicle where Keanu's Wick dispatches so many bad guys you lose count within the first half hour. He does it with some impressive martial arts (much more polished and realistic than what he did in The Matrix) and guns that suggest laser tag, video game artistry, and Men In Black (I wasn't the only critic who picked up on this). As you watch John Wick, you don't condemn it, but you wonder how it didn't somehow land in the straight-to-DVD category. Basically, the whole point with this October release is that the filmmakers throw in scene after scene of non-stop death and destruction. It's to distract you from realizing how generic and tepid it is.

So OK, here are some things I pondered while viewing this bad boy with an undernourished 101 minute running time: 1. why doesn't anybody in this movie bother to wear a bulletproof vest? I mean Wick shoots a lot of his enemies in the chest. This might bring down the body count a little. 2. why does the antagonist (in this case, Viggo Tarasov played by Michael Nyqvist) not shoot the protagonist when he's defenseless and without weapon? You know he's gonna eventually get ya in the end if you let him live. Jeez! 3. do the lives of 50+ people have to end just because a dog died? I mean, I know the dog was Wick's last gift that reminded him of his dead wife but come on! He knew Daisy (dog's name) for one or two sequences, that's it. And yet, just about everyone that wasn't involved in Daisy's passing gets the death incarnate treatment. In general, I can't help but thinking that John Wick is trying to be a parody of your everyday vindictive, revenge fare. When Wick says the Russian gangsters took everything from him, I guess he left out the fact that he still has his beautiful home, expensive, tailor made suits, and plenty of discretionary wealth.

In conclusion, this thing is mildly mediocre but I found the lead role of a former, humblized contract killer to be a nice fit for Keanu Reeves. He's one of those actors that is better off saying the bare minimum of dialogue in order to get through a movie. His job here is to look cool, act cool, and basically exude a brooding screen presence. In his 42nd feature film, he pulls it off with veritable aplomb.

During the second half of John Wick, Keanu's title character says quote unquote, "people keep asking if I'm back, yeah I'm thinking I'm back." Not entirely Mr. cool breeze. But nice try though. You're getting there.

Of note: In terms of John Wick's stylistic voyeurism, look for a dance club scene where Reeves gets his kill-on Tom Cruise style (a la 2004's Collateral). Also, look for various subtitles in "Wick" that seem akin to the ones used in Tony Scott's Man on Fire (also from 2004). In the realm of casting, be on the lookout for three high profile actors who's roles are underdeveloped (with most of their scenes probably left on the cutting room floor). John Leguizamo plays a chop shop owner, Willem Dafoe plays a fellow hit-man and friend of Wick's character, and Bridget Moynahan plays Wick's character's wife. Oh and watch for the goofy guy from the Allstate commercials (Dean Winters, you know Mr. Mayhem) in a small role as the main villain's fruitful lackey.
Didn't like it. Looks like videogame. Characters are shallow.

title: Tour-de-force in action choreography, but not much else
review:
John Wick is the sort of film you only watch if you really like action movies... and I mean that you *really* have to like them. The choreography is great and really delivers that fantasy that John Wick is just an indestructible assassin.

Unfortunately that's about all the movie has to offer.

The plot is minimal, almost tacked-on. There is no character development. There is nothing this movie has to say. There is no intrigue, no drama, no comedy, no romance (thankfully). It's just one and a half hours of constant action choreography with a laughably weak "video game" plot. It like like watching someone play a video game. That may be your thing, but for me it wore very thin. By saying all that I almost feel like I've given away spoilers.

What makes John Wick most disappointing though, is that Keanu's been in better action movies, with better action scenes, and with philosophical themes and social commentary. Like... "The Matrix"? Compared to that movie, John Wick is very weak indeed as a piece of cinema. I don't understand why people rate it highly - although it works as a piece of cathartic release, or something to watch for "Netflix and chill" - where the point of the movie is not to actually watch it.

title: It doesn't get better than this!
review: The first thirty minutes of this film are pure perfection. John Wick's wife dies of a disease, she gives him a cute puppy to love, Russian thugs steal his car, beat him, and kill the dog. Wick seeks revenge. Best line of the film- Michael Nyqvist, when told that the reason his son was punched in the face was that his son stole John Wick 's car and killed his dog, simply replies, "Oh." Must see film for Keanu fans!

title: Nunber 1 in Top Action Thriller of all time
review:
The first movie of this trilogy mark the name Keanu Reeves as a great actor in my mind. And thats all.

From the first production to the latest one, movies are Action Packed from every Angle, every angle possible. Directed to a precision of masterpiece Diamond. Truly legend level acting. title: Action extrodanire...
review: This is what happens when u have the Best Action Hero, the best stunt director, the best stunt men & the best stunt everything minus the Cheap CGI & cheap dialogues...IF ACTION is what u crave...action is what you will get...movie never disappoints and the music during the action is the ice-ing on the cake...thank you John Wick for the mind boggelling action...see u in the sequel...

title: Not profound, not Shakespeare... but kinetic fun
review:
This movie would never win a screenplay Oscar, but that's almost not the point here. This is a B movie, with choreographed fight scenes galore - and if you take it on it's own terms, it's kind of fun.

It actually makes a nice change from Marvel and DC antics, where CGI seems to be always the king or queen. Here, there's old school beat em up, Hong Kong kung fu inspired cinema back on the screen again. It's almost a throw back to 80s and before fight flicks in this way.

A simple revenge theme drives the film, and it suits Keanu's brooding persona well. The movie gets some decent acting chops from Alfie Allen and the late Michael Nyqvist, and a sly Willem Defoe, in fleshing out otherwise simply drawn and thinly written characters. Watch out also for a key character from 'The Wire' in a quietly scene stealing turn, whenever they're on screen.

If you're looking for docu drama, and high realism, then take a pass. if you put the brain on 'get this' mode though for an old school pop corn fight flick, John Wick is definitely an entertaining few hours.

title: Legendary.
review: They killed his dog and stole his car ... John Wick is legendary.

title: love This Movie ...and character also
review: I have never been a huge fan of Keanu Reeves. Even in The Matrix, which is a great film, his acting falls pretty flat to me. He hasn't showed me anything that can make him a true thespian on screen. But as John Wick, he's perfect. i highly recomended for this movie

title: John wick
review: I heard this was one of the best action movies of the decade but I was still a bit skeptical at first because how action movies have been heading down far but it does not let down the action scenes were buetiful and I really liked their originality of it and of course you have Keanu Reeves not mad max fury road good but still shows how we can still make a good R rated action movie that doesn't have superhero's

title: Keanu Reeves reinvented
review:
What can I say? This was a turning point for Keanu Reeves, this is where middle-aged man broke every stereotype and became a legendary killer of hearts. He basically conquered the internet and all cinephiles with John Wick's performance.

The plot is simple but this is exactly what it takes to introduce ruthless killing machine. You need only a slight push and a sledge of calculated revenge will go right down the track. Precise choreography of fights is absolutely amazing, you can feel the flow and all the skill set that John has developed throughout his career, but the age takes its toll, so you can see that humanizing rustiness. The gun wielding was incredibly entertaining, you could add it to the list of things you can watch forever, like fire and water.

Another interesting feature is that the Russian language was spoken pretty decently without the iconic Jason Bourne random letter stuff. I mention this because it boosts Keanu Reeves' dedication to the role, even a smallest detail is approaching perfection in hands of this guy.

Additional perks of the movie include an amazing soundtrack with Marilyn Manson's song "Killing Strangers" that immediately jumped into my playlist. Talking about a treat to your ears: voices of Ian McShane and Willem Dafoe as well as their on-screen presents are just a blessing.

Overall, the movie is a keeper. I will definitely revisit it again, and recommend you to see for yourself this quality action that gives you the charge of brutality and dedication from one and only Keanu Reeves.

title: Wow. Fun & Educational!!
review:
What I knew before watching: 1. Based on a graphic novel. 2. 2 sequels. 3. Violent.

What I discovered in under 15 minutes: BEST REVENGE MOVIE EVER!!

Why I learned this: As a father, if I ever punched my kid in the stomach so hard he puked-twice!-then said, "You will do nothing...because you can do nothing...", the guy in the other end would be the meanest MF ever walking the earth!

Other key lessons: 1. MUCH better to be the violent psychologic killer's friend than to stand in his way. 2. Always double-tap. 3. Chaos doesn't speak Russian. 4. Daisy is the cutest movie dog ever.

I wondered about this movie for over 3 years before finally watching (the sanitized-for-TV version). Definitely worth it.

title: John Wick the action and emotionally packed movie that doesn't shift away from violence
review:
This movie is such an overwhelming film filled with so many exceptional action packed scenes that have insanely great choreography to match it. But at the same time the movie has spectacular dialog to help us understand why John Wick does what he does in this movie. Another fantastic thing in this movie is all the acting in this movie is just so perfect and acted out amazingly by every actor.
John Wick is about a legendary ex-assassin named John Wick (Keanu Reeves) who is brought back into the fold out of retirement from his violent career because some ruthless mobsters take away John's favorite car and kill the last present his wife gives him after she dies which is a puppy. But John releases the unforgiving killing machine inside himself and is out to get retribution for their actions. While at the same time the leader of the Russian mob named Virgo Tarasov (Michael Nyqvist) puts out a giant reward for John's head because he is trying to kill his son Losef Tarasov (Alfie Allen).
Directors Chad Stahelski and David Leitch did a great job with this movie showing how they can make a really slick looking movie with superb action scenes but also create amazing dialog scenes to go with the movie. Both Stahelski and Leitch are veteran stuntman and in John Wick they really show how well they can direct a movie. Unlike Victor Armstrong who is also a veteran stuntman, he was great at being a stuntman but when it came to directing a movie it didn't go as great. Also I love how the directors are able to understand the whole action packed parts of the movie and just how wonderful they are to showing it. One of the only problems I have with the movie is the beginning and the ending to John Wick, it just seems so tacked on and could have been done better.
I would personally say that John Wick is one of Keanu Reeves best movie performances he's ever had to do, well all of the John Wick movies so far. But this is probably one of his best yet. John Wick requires so much out of Keanu Reeves from all of the stunt work he does to all of the emotional scenes. On a side note I would like to add that Keanu Reeves does almost all of his stunt work in John Wick so to get prepared for this movie he had to do a lot of extra training to get physically prepared for the movie. But I would personally say that it really paid off for Keanu Reeves to do the extra work.
In the trailer for this movie you see that some Russian mobsters kill his puppy and take his car and then he goes to seek revenge. I would say that in the movie it explains more into the reason why he goes seeking for vengeance and at first when you watch the trailer you're probably telling yourself how stupid of a reason that is to go on the bloody trail that he does in order for vengeance. But when you watch the movie from start to finish you start putting yourself into John's shoes and you are more understanding into why he does what he does.
Also when you watch the movie, you start to see how the writer (Derek kolstad) is kind of building the world that John Wick is in and how it helps set up for more John Wick sequels to be made and not seem forced on us. The writer creates this whole underground secret organisation of criminals. Unlike the movie series called The Maze Runner where at the end of the movie it just says and there's gonna be more movie. In John Wick it just builds the universe for more sequels to happen and it also shows the immense potential in the franchise.
John Wick is such a wonderful piece of work and I would recommend every action movie lover to see it. But also I believe that this movie would be great for almost anyone above the age of fifteen only because it is rated R. Also if you are a Keanu Reeves fan then I definitely believe you should see it due to his performance. But whatever you do when you see this movie don't view it for just the action. Take the whole movie all together.

title: Iconic Action Movie of the 2010's
review:
John Wick is a no-questions-asked action thriller that keeps the audience wanting more.

Action-porn cannot begin to describe this movie. Lots of gunplay and dead unnamed Russian thugs. It's a fun watch for those who enjoy the genre.

The storyline was a bit dull. Someone kills John Wick's dog and he goes out for revenge. The end. Some of the dialogue seemed forced or shallow.

One area this film did do well in is how Keanu did all his own stunts. That's one reason why this film became iconic in its genre.

3.5/5. Though the film was a fun watch, the shallowness of the story didn't make it memorable to me. A 4/5 on a good day.

title: A perfect action movie
review: It's got literally everything that a great action movie needs. A villain who is easy to hate, a hero who isn't exactly a good guy, incredibly well-choreographed and well-thought-out action scenes, cool cars, a cool soundtrack, some interesting lore (The International Hotel is such a cool idea) and cool scenery. I love this movie and if you want to watch a long-haired, sad Keanu Reeves be the baddest mamma jamma on the face of the planet, in interesting and vaguely sinister and settings you are in the right place.

title: Mindblowing action!
review:
Action films nowadays have been a joke. Aside from the Mission: Impossible series, there hasn't been one where the action makes you extremely excited or grip the edge of your seat. Luckily, we have John Wick to show us how action is really done.

John Wick is a hit-man who is in retirement but some gangsters take away everything he loves which forces him to come out of retirement and hunt them down.

John Wick has a very basic plot. It's a revenge story that's been done many times and hence why its story doesn't feel very innovative but what sells this film is the ACTION! As directors this is Chad Stahelski and David Leitch's first film and they've done an exceptional job. As both of them are stuntmen it's logical for them to know a lot about action and it's evident from this film that they do. Each sequence has a stylish flair present within them and each kill is different from the other which makes this movie so entertaining to watch. The choreography and camerawork is simply perfect. There are some long takes used during the action which increases the intensity of the scene and keeps your adrenaline flowing.

This film is filled with action which never ventures into boredom. This is largely due to the fantastic direction and extraordinary commitment by Keanu Reeves. After The Matrix, Keanu Reeves's career did go downhill. He needed something huge to bring him back into the Hollywood scene and John Wick did exactly that. Reeves is perfect for this role. He is the definition of awesome as he possesses this swagger that's present in each scene. His commitment to the action is praiseworthy. You can tell that he's doing most of the stunts rather than having a stuntman to do it for him. It conveys to us how much he cared about this film.

Whilst the story is very predictable, the film does do a great job of showing us who John Wick is. Throughout the movie we learn how powerful this man was in the underworld before his retirement. We see how many people are associated with him and the film repeatedly shows how fearful people are towards him which portrays how unstoppable John Wick is.

Overall, John Wick is one of the best action films made. The USP of this movie is its action and there is plently scattered across this movie. Keanu Reeves does a fantastic job as John Wick and I praise his dedication towards the film's stunts. If you want to have an exhilarating experience for 1 hour and 40 minutes then John Wick is the film for you.

title: A Really Awesome Action Flick
review:
John Wick is one of Keanu Reeves' best movies. It has tons of high-scaled action, one heck of a plot, and runs in a fast and steady pace for 100 minutes.

Thi movie is about a man, John Wick (played by Reeves), who retired from being an assassin after the death of his wife. A savage mobster and his thugs then steal Wick's priceless car and kill his puppy. So now, it's time for Wick to seek vengeance and kill the people that screwed him over.

I would say this is also a perfect example of a revenge flick. Similar to Kill Bill, the protagonist must get back at the person for killing something of theirs.

"John Wick" has a lot of great action scenes. It has enough to satisfy an audience to where they are speechless.

The acting is great. Keanu had one hell of a performance in this and he knew what he had to do in order for this movie to be action packed. All the other cast members did a really good job as well.

The one thing I do not like about this film is when the puppy dies. That scene was so hard to watch and makes you want to cry because you feel bad for him. But thankfully, Wick manages to get back at the bad guys for doing that.

All in all, John Wick is outstanding, and is one of the best movies of 2014. Highly recommend it.

It is my 3rd favorite movie of 2014 after "Guardians of the Galaxy", and "Interstellar".

title: Puts the Fun Back in the Action Movie
review:
It's cheesy, formulaic, and hammily acted. It's also stylish, high energy, and generally just a fun popcorn movie.

"John Wick" is a retired hitman who gets brought back into the life by a personal attack (no spoilers here, but if you're squeamish about animal cruelty, be warned). Okay, we've heard this story dozens of times.

What's different is the world in which this takes place. There's a secret criminal underground that seems to have their hands in everything, and there's a specific code and honor among thieves. Actually, come to think of it, we never really meet anyone who isn't involved or in the know somehow, so it's implied that this society is very widespread and possibly runs everything. This film actually seems to have more in common with the "Wanted" comic book than the "Wanted" movie did.

Part of the style and identification with the near superhuman Keanu Reeves as Wick is that he isn't a perfect action hero. He gets hurt. A lot. Unlike Neo, he's not invincible. He's simply very well trained and determined, which makes the combat sequences more interesting because, even though you know the outcome, there's always this little part in the back of your mind that wonders if he'll come out in one piece, making them gritty and...semi-realistic. Let's be honest, a lot of the action moves are very theatrical and wouldn't have much practical value in the real world.

Given the implications for how big this criminal underworld probably is, it seems to have been set up to be a franchise from the start. From background characters like Ian McShane's Winston (who keeps referring to Wick as "Jonathan" even though the name is John; different spelling means it isn't a shortened version of his name) to Lance Reddick's hotel manager (who I would swear there is more going on with this character and hopefully gets explored later), there's a lot of ground to explore. It's not a smart or challenging film, but it is fun and not a bad way to spend a couple hours if you like action movies.

title: One of The Best Action Movies of All Time!
review: I'll be honest if someone were to kill my dog I'd probably go insane, but John Wick is able to take this concept of loss, and make it into an amazing action movie all about revenge. title: Should be called "John Wick should have died 100 times". A great movie until you think about it
review:
The basic premise of this movie is that Wick is a retired assassin on a revenge rampage. We're supposed to empathise with a man who was and is a ruthless, amoral killer whose former employer included a Russian mafia boss.

Then we're supposed to believe that this man is so well known that the entire city knows him, yet he lives alone in a literal glass house with zero security.

The local town has an assassin's hotel and hangout big enough to house the population of Yankee Stadium, and luxurious enough to have the budget of a small country. And this is not played for laughs or weirdness - it's just a thing.

The assassin himself roller coasters between supposed awesome displays of lethal skill, and breathtaking, showboating ineptitude, such as simply getting back into the vehicle that was stolen from him and returned, without checking if it's bugged or booby trapped, recovering from his failed hit in a hotel known for homing assassins without drawing the curtains or securing the door, or taking on the boss and his most deadly henchmen in a carpark without remotely securing the area.

The number of times Wick just blasely strolled, without so much as a pair of sunglasses or a cap to disguise his identity, into situations with dozens of trained killers waiting for him was downright insulting.

The gunplay was stupidly showy, the martial arts was stupidly ineffective and flashy, and every actual hand to hand fight was in the dark.

I liked the movie at the time but hated it in retrospect. Every scene was a massive insult to my intelligence. It lacked the comic book hyper reality of Sin City yet it was far too silly to consider as a serious attempt at the genre. Fal, fail, fail.

Is it not time to devote creative endeavours to something a bit more meaningful?

title: Another Review
review:
John Wick (2014) is a typical action movie about a man taking revenge. The movie started with John Wick get out from a car while badly injured, then the screen goes black and showing him at his wife funeral. At the first 20 minutes of the movie, it's showing us about the daily life of a no one man named John Wick and how his dog killed and how his car get robbed too.

But after that 20 minutes running time, the movie started to show us about how badass he is and horrible his job world before. its turn out that John Wick was an ex-legendary hit-man that retired after his marriage. Even the car robber father who's was one of his old clients afraid of him so much and tell us how dangerous John Wick was that he killed 3 armed men just with a pencil. Then after that, the movie continues with John Wick shoots people in the face until the end of the movie.

As far as I know, John Wick is the best action movie series. This movie is just filled with pure action, there was never a dull moment happened. There is no pointless long dialogue that makes action sequence to sequence felt confusing. Every action sequence in this movie is amazingly executed, you will never have trouble to understand what happened in front of you. All you need to do is sit tight and enjoy the movie.

title: Action packed and that's all
review:
Lots of action scenes, some executed beautifully but no story, no character development, very little dialogue for Keanu (okay, maybe that's a good thing), no plot.

What's the point of the little videos of his wife and telling us she's dead without explaining the how our the why. Surely if she was killed, he'd be more concerned with avenging her than his car and the dog he had for 2 days? Might as well have written him as a bachelor.

The policeman turns up at his door after he kills 12 men in his house, the police officer sees the bodies and the blood on his face, but it's okay because he's John Wick.

Supposedly, he's the top hit man but we don't see him working, just getting revenge.

title: HOT LEAD and cute dog
review: If there's a modern movie that better exemplifies the 80s action movie, I don't think I've come across it. The plot doesn't really have twists, and there are basically no subplots to speak of; it's just a straight line from beginning to finish. Reeves plays the titular retired hitman who's just lost his wife (to cancer) but who receives a beagle as a final present from her, delivered after her death. He has the dog for like two days before Russian mobsters invade his house to steal his vintage Mustang and kill the dog just for kicks. And thus the most plausible revenge plot in history is set into motion. There's a LOT of violence. A lot of characters die. Some of the action is very reminiscent of The Matrix. The weaponry is impressive, as is the hand-to-hand combat. There's a lot to love about John Wick the movie, as long as you're part of the intended audience, i.e., the action-movie fan.

title: A Surprisingly Stylish Action Movie
review: This exceeded my expectations and I really enjoyed it. The plot is a basic one almost bordering on ludicrous, retired hitman is wronged and seeks revenge but when the action starts, wow. Reeves is excellent as the hero, the action sequences are slick and original, the mood, lighting and soundtrack rocks. There is humour and originality in many aspects to the movie. I especially liked the hotel for Villains storyline, which I believe they may be turning into a TV series. A really good watch. I only had one real gripe. Reeves is wronged at the start of the movie by three/four Russian Mafia but then goes on a rampage where he quite easily slaughters hundreds without breaking a sweat. Surely these few hoods at the start could not take out such a seasoned assassin. Then again it is Hollywood and without it we would not have a movie so will let it slide. Great Saturday night popcorn movie entertainment

title: An Above Average Action Thriller
review: 25 October 2014. John Wick is graphic with plenty of bloody special effects, especially to the upper body. This movie introduces an appealing cerebral element that the director or screen writer along with a more layered antagonist making making for its own Bourne Identity (2002) character. The interplay between John Wick and his former partner is consistently developed and brings a tense evolving relational element not part of too many action thrillers. There are two lighter scenes which offer up a nice break in the action without having to sacrifice the serious dramatic tone of the movie. Entertaining, satisfying, and adding some nice new martial art touches. Worth the money to see it though.

title: Acción de la wena
review: Después de verla dos veces, debo decir que mi primera impresión de esta película fue bastante cegada por los grandes momentos de acción que presenta John Wick, pero después de verla de nuevo recientemente, eso es todo lo que tiene que ofrecer. Sí, esos momentos de acción son brillantes, pero eso es todo, no hay un fondo decente, está lleno de clichés del género y, a la larga, es una película bastante mala en su totalidad. Es refrescante y un mérito total su contribución al género en términos de coreografía y acción, pero nada más. Es genial pasar el tiempo pero no te invita a apreciarlo de otra manera. Si tuviera que compararle con algo, sería con un buen videojuego de disparos, no uno con una historia fascinante, sino uno divertido y con el que pasar el rato, pero que al finalizarlo no aporta nada a tu vida.

title: Somewhere between Riddick and ridiculous
review:
Am I the only one that didn't really appreciate this movie?

I gave it 6/10, for the stellar action scenes. If that's all you want from a movie, it's a 10/10. If on the other hand you expect a movie not to insult your intelligence with some ridiculous story and situations, then this movie is lacking. Everybody dreads John Wick, and he can kill you with anything, like he's freaking Riddick or something. That may work for Vin Diesel in a fantasy science-fiction setting, but not here. Yeah, yeah, people say the movie doesn't take itself seriously, and the ridiculousness is tongue-in-cheek, but for some reason it doesn't click for me. So no. 6 out of 10.
