title: A fresh kind of action
review:
The new franchise to boost Keanu Reeves acting career, is certainly gonna go down as the best action movie of 2014! It has a great cast with very serious and grim performances, while still being charming and intimidating.

The film starts off with a very generic plot - "mans wife dies, leaves a dog - home-invaders kills dog and steals car, man sets out to avenge the crimes.". Even though it had me bored for the first 10 minutes of plot-building, I got so immersed as soon as the action and dialogue started popping. The cinematography and style is so beautiful and different from other action films, which makes it a unique and fresh breath into the genre. The film is also filled with stunning performances from Reeves and the compelling antagonist - even a surprise performance from Willem Dafoe.

One thing I noticed during the action, is the fact that the kamera-work has shy completely away from "shaky-cam", which is much harder to achieve and so pleasant to look at. It makes the action more tangible and easy to follow.

Even though the plot is not really a new thing, it's unveiled and structured with such grace, that the only critique - is the simplicity of it all. But overall a really satisfying action-flick, that clearly blew me away.

title: Master piece
review: Legendary movie, probably one of the best action movies i have seen in a long time.

title: Master piece
review: After a long time I saw this kind of revenge movie.the dialogue of this movie just awesome.10 out of 10.

title: Hypnotized somewhat
review: Need to make a John wick on how he became John wick for real ,the younger years......epic money!!!!!!

title: A few things come to mind
review:
After watching John Wick afew things come to mind :

1) Probably one of the best action movies ever made 2) Theres more dialogue in an episode of Teletubbies 3) You know the story would have played out alloooot differently if his wife gave him a cat 4) John Wick would be like ' ye , f&%k that cat ... I didnt like it either' 5) Keanu Reeves is one of the biggest bad asses out there 6) After this movie peeps be like ' Keanu Reeves is the best ' ... Im like 'Bitch please , Keanu Reeves has been killing it since Point Break 7) Body count is 84 , excluding the dog 8 ) Damn .... John Leguizamo got really old ... and really fat 9) Keanu Reeves hasnt aged at all since 'Bill & Ted' 10) Best date night movie , GF loved it 11) GF be like ' oh no , they killed his dog !! Those f+£kers better die !!'

title: Fun to watch
review:
This film tells the story of a retired assassin who is forced out of hiding by a gangster's son who doesn't know who he is messing with.

I watched the sequel first then this film, and I think this film is more realistic than the sequel. At least in here John Wick gets hurt! It is stylish and is fun to watch.

title: John Wick is Reeves's best film in years
review: John Wick might be Keanu Reeve's best movie in years. a stylish revenge movie that grabs your heart and attention in the first few minutes and hold you on the edge of your seat for the following ninety. The action in this movie is beautifully choreographed and very satisfying. This is a must see movies for any fan of action movies such as the original Taken or Collateral. IT was my favorite movie of 2014 and I have to give it 9/10. I love this movie.

title: Dialogue not needed
review: Some films are at their best when they are monosyllabic. Every rhythm, moment and action sequence here was familiar, but this movie knew what it was...through and through. The action did the talking, and the characters did the opposite. The stylized violence became almost a dance: music + guns, no words required. And - other than the few moments of Keanu talking - it was pretty perfect.

title: OMG
review: When this movie released, I thought it was just a normal action movie. But it changed my mind. I watched it over 10 times and I was never bored. Rather I wanna be John Wick.

title: Not quite there
review:
The simplicity of this film is attractive. Straightforward characters, motivations and storytelling. It doesn't get hung up on unnecessary backstory or fleshing out characters beyond what they need to be. For an all-out action film, this is a good and refreshingly honest choice - it maintains the pace, makes the transitions through the story slick, and allows you to sit back and enjoy it. It is also a risky tactic, because the lack of depth demands that every element of the film be tight and foolproof. It nearly pulls it off - the performances, which have to drive the narrative and create the energy in the absence of detail - are all excellent, and the leads very well cast.

Unfortunately, the film seems to chicken out at certain crucial moments, falling back on tired tropes to manufacture tension. Wick makes one or two decisions which do not fit in with the limited picture we have of him, and therefore feel incongruous. There's a clumsy 'kill everyone except the woman and then regret it later' cliché. Most disappointing is the age-old 'antagonist walks away leaving henchmen to kill hero' trope, which feels utterly stupid and out of place in a world constructed as deliberately ruthless. Viggo is supposed to understand the situation and the man he is up against. He knows his ability to escape impossible situations, and he knows how many times his own men have failed. He has no affection for John, and he wants him dead, but he leaves his armed henchmen alone in the room to suffocate him with a plastic bag!? This ruins the whole atmosphere and aesthetic of the film.

Despite these disappointing moments, this has enough to it to make it a worthwhile watch. An honest action flick is one to be praised.

title: Video game violence with some Charles Bronson thrown in
review: This film is nothing more than a reimagining of those old movies from the 70s where some evil people kill a guy's wife/family/dog/whatever and he goes on a bloody vendetta. The Outlaw Josey Wales comes to mind, or basically any Charles Bronson film, with a touch of Taken and The Usual Suspects thrown in. There is no time to get to know any of the characters, they have zero depth, which is fitting since Keanu Reeves lacks the ability to portray three-dimensional characters. As the body count piles up, Willem Dafoe's character drifts in here and there, but he isn't given much to do except look pensive and drift away again. This is the perfect film to watch if you just want to zone out and not think very much, there are no challenging ideas for you to struggle with, just lots and lots of stabbings, shootings, and head-bashings. It must have been incredibly easy to write the script for this film.

title: A Complete Ridicule Of Insensible Violence
review: Credible in itself yet rooted around one complete ridicule of violence over an individual theme of revenge which is universally baseless. A five outta ten is significantly worth the making. Besides some pretty cool dialogues and one-liners, the film does catch the moods of poignancy and darkness quite vividly and exceptionally though! Could've been a six from my side, but the theme and violence confined my mouse to five.

title: WhAt Is It
review: Is it a bird? Is it a plane? Is it a UFO? No It's John Wicks bullet. This movie is probably the best action movie I've watched. For me when Kenu did the matrix he was amazing but this, this is his next big great movie I can't wait for JONH WICK 3 That movie will probably be amazing no spoilers.

title: Terrific action flick.
review: After John Wick loses his wife Helen to a terminal illness, he receives a beagle puppy named Daisy, per Helen's instructions, to help him cope with her death. He connects with the puppy and they spend their day driving around in his vintage 1969 Ford Mustang Mach 1. At a gas station, he encounters a trio of Russian gangsters whose leader, Iosef Tarasov, insists on buying his car, but John refuses to sell it. The mobsters follow John to his home that night, knock him unconscious, steal his car, and kill Daisy.

title: It's a good action film, which is rare.
review: This is a fast paced action film that gets a solid 8/10 for the genre. The plot is a little thin, but compelling none-the-less. Don't expect too much talk from the lead character, he's all about business and getting done what needs doing. Well worth a watch - hoping 'Chapter 2' isn't a needless extension for the sake of franchise dollars.

title: Admiring his action!!!
review: The story is about a miserable man. He loses all his things to need to protect and revenges himself on his enemies who deprive him of the dog which is sent from died beloved as a memory. Although the subject matter is dark and sad, I think that the audience loves him because his anger is intense and his quick action is bold and beautiful. Interesting point is that he is known well to people around. Everybody knows his ability to fight. He is wonderful killer. The audience can see the story from his angle, so they are able to feel as if they were really super strong. Anyone will come to like him. Another point which the audience should notice is that this film depicts the black society. To be able to watch what we basically do not experience is goodness of films.

title: Best film I've seen in years and the best Keanu Reeves film since The Materix if not arguably better.
review: For the people rating this film low, quite frankly I find your lack of taste and intelligence disturbing as your narcissistic view of other people like me who adore this silly yet badass film about vengeance. Nevertheless there is little I have to complain about this film.NOW SPOILERS AHEAD! I think it simply a near perfect film about how a oddly relatable super assassin who is just grieving the loss of his wife and just wants to be left alone and have some semblance of peace in his life but some punks who think they are just the coolest guys ever come in and break into his home kill his dog and foolishly because they are typical foolish thugs leave the man alive... from the beginning of the film up to that point you are 120% on John Wick's side as he effortlessly just dispatches men like they are ants with the mob boss running scared doing everything he can think of to keep the legendary Baba Yaga from slaughtering him and his entire family and his entire syndicate even attempting to hire a man that could have possibly picked off John Wick but ultimately betrays his own mob boss client in favor of John at the cost of his life. I really don't have much bad to say about this film other than it is admittingly silly and over the top but that is also what makes it so charming and fantastic and the film even is aware that it is silly but yet it's entertaining from beginning to the very end. It gets a very rare 10/10 from me.

title: Superman
review: Although is full of action is boring, since it's easy to anticipate. Keanu Reeves is not Daniel Craig, not the best actor, no style. After seeing the first movie I won't bother for the second one. The same old tricks, not surprising, ugly cars, no matter how strong was hit he'll be back on his feet as new.

title: Good Evening, Mr Wick
review:
On paper, this film looks like a typical action film. However the things that set this film apart is the stylishness of the film and the incredible world it creates

First of all, Keanu Reeves shows he still has what it takes to be a successful actor. He gives a multi layered performance as Mr Wick, and makes you fear this fictional character, and after watching the film i am thankful. One thing that adds to the film is that Reeves did that majority of his own stunts, this makes the action feel more fluid and the man even more bad-ass. After seeing Reeves in this film, i could imagine no one else in the role.

The films strongest trait, is the fight sequences. Once the action starts, it never seems to stop. The fights are brilliantly choreographed and they seem realistic and brutal. The mixture of martial arts the character uses shows real skill, and adds to the realistic feel of the film and world created. John Wick proves himself capable of killing with both hands and firearm. If you're a fan of brilliant action sequences, then this is the film for you.

The only criticism of the film is the plot. Although the story brilliantly creates a world of assassins, the plot itself is nothing new and has been seen before, however despite this i was left satisfied that i had not seen an action film like it.

Overall, John Wick left me wanting more and is a real treat for action fans and Keanu fans. Bring on John Wick Chapter 2.

title: Mindless action fun
review:
I think I'm a little late to the party on this one and I guess it must have cost me. I'm an action-movie fan. I grew up in the Arnie/Sly era of the eighties and I have plenty of mindless action flicks in my DVD collection – everything from 'Commando' to the mode recent 'Shoot 'em Up' pleases me to a degree and Keanu Reeves pops up a fair times in my watchlist. However, somehow his film where he plays the titular 'John Wick' slipped past me. I've only just seen it after its sequel was released and, during that time, I've seen many a positive review saying how great it was. Therefore, by the time I got round to watching it, my hopes were high.

I guess what happened is the reverse of when I watched 'Sex Tape' and the big screen adaptation of 'The Dukes of Hazzard.' Both had been absolutely slated by the critics so my expectations were suitably lowered by the time I saw them. And, weirdly enough, I actually took some small amount of entertainment in both! I'm not saying either were particularly good, but enjoyable enough if you were in the right mood. This time, my hopes were so high, I found that what I got didn't really live up to what I was expecting. I was waiting for something truly revolutionary and different from anything I'd seen before. What I got felt like just another action movie.

Don't get me wrong – it's not bad. It was enjoyable enough, but it wasn't anything I hadn't seen before. John Wick is a retired hit-man who's forced out of retirement when a baddie (played by 'Game of Throne's' Alfie Allen) kills his dog. Yes, that's basically the catalyst and motivation for the entire film. What follows is your average (and I deliberately use the word 'average') roller-coaster of violence and revenge. Everything you'd expect is there: gunfights are plentiful, there's at least one car chase, a betrayal and eventually Wick comes face to face with the evil head honcho. So it's all there. And it's well done. The violence (and there is violence – no PG13 here!) is believable and gritty and Keanu Reeves is always fun to watch (even when he's trying to be moody and miserable he's still that long-haired 'bogus' surfer-dude we all fell in love with back in the early nineties). So, I can see how there's much going for it. I was just expecting more. And that's a shame really because my hopes were so high that, even though everything I like was – technically – there, I still came away with the feeling like it wasn't that much of a big deal. But, like I said earlier, a sequel has been made and I will definitely watch that, too.

At the end of the day, this film may not have entirely clicked with me, but I'm glad that Keanu Reeves is back in a decent franchise and it puts him back in the spotlight – maybe John Wick can team up with Liam Neeson in a Wick/Taken crossover? ;o)

title: Amazingly Violent, Senseless Entertainment
review: Very good action movie that is worth watching. Very good characters, and awesome story-line. It is quick pace, and throws you right into the story, and holds you there until the final scene. The characters are likable, believable, and have audacity. The scenes are well done, and consist of some of the greatest gun-play that I have seen in any movie.

title: Certainly not as good as some portray here
review: One of my friends suggested me to watch this movie because of my love for the Max Payne video game series. One good thing about this movie is Keanu. He looks cool throughout the movie (a bit blunt here and there but that's okay). The dialogue, story and the co-stars and supporting actors did a terrible job. I have seen movie with thin story-line but they stand tall with the execution (screenplay, dialogues). Unfortunately, John Wick is not one among them.

title: The gangsters Took Everything from John Wick?
review:
Did the gangsters give John Wick's wife cancer? No but they did take everything else that was left after his wife died. Now a broken man who placed heavy sentiment on his car and dog. The unfortunate thieves were John Wick's boss' son and friends. What motivation did they really have to steal the car? I mean they're rich. Just ask your dad to buy a car like that, you idiot.

So they kill his dog but they have the NERVE to steal his car. How dare they? Revenge! Silly premise. Brutal action and lots of killing. Ridiculous but enjoyable I guess.

title: One of the best action films of all time
review:
Keanu Reeves is an immense performer as John Wick. He is an elite hit man on a revenge mission. His name is enough for his enemies to question their decisions, its foreshadowed in the whole movie.

It is an awesome action movie a deep story and a strong character arch and produced with the slick action techniques of today. Which you will see in very few films.

Unlike most action movies of this era, this film does not rely on quick and nauseating camera movement to show off its cool action moves, instead it uses steady and uncut scenes for you to appreciate how much of a bad ass Keanu Reeves is.

It one of those hidden gems that are between these piles of garbage. If you hit it you are rich. It one of those which deserve popularity but is dragged down by the lack of promotion. I am so glad I watched this.

Looking forward to John Wick: Chapter 2.

title: extraordinary
review: This is an extraordinary movie. Even if it's only about shootings and fights it is still amazing and very entertaining to watch and serious

title: Guns guns guns
review:
It's the story of Theon Greyjoy who kills the puppy dog of a professional assassin(irony?). This assassin has no purpose in life other than to shoot other assassins. They all hang out in the same club and buildings, which is very practical in this kind of situation of course.

As the French would say, not bad for an action flick. But I'm definitely over gun fights and gun choreography in movies so I didn't enjoy this one as much as some people. There's really not much in terms of story arc and character development.

title: Very Interesting.
review: Another awesome performance from Keanu Reeves. I really like the plot. All the action are very nice executed, if some real fighting moves from martial arts. I like the shooting scenes and for these one, Keanu received some special training. The soundtrack is another interesting thing from the movie, it fit well. I am looking forward to see the second movie of that one, released earlier this year, 2017. For action movies fans, Keanu Reeves fans, this is another movie to be seen.

title: Wow
review:
John Wick is an amazing action movie. It is everything that I love about action revenge type of movies and I think this one nailed it out of the park.

Keanu Reeves performance as the title character was awesome. He didn't need to say a word for you to feel what he felt and that is awesome.

You can get behind his character 100% and root for him. If you like action and revenge movies I HIGHLY suggest this movie.

title: love it
review: just wondering where the sudden rain and lightning came from when Viggo pushes John's car off the ledge on the docks. side question 0% of all millionaires go all the way across the city to a helicopter at the docks. love the movie just confused. if John is after me I would go somewhere other than my house to sit and wait.

title: One of the best action movies of the decade
review:
The bloody action movie added a new style to action and reignited the long career of Keanu Reeves as an action star. John Wick (Reeves0 is a retired assassin who has moved on to a simple life with his wife when she dies of cancer. Overcome with grief, Wick is only able to have a semblance of hope from the gift his wife left him, a small puppy. Wick encounters Russian gangster Iosef Tarasov (Alfie Allen) and seemingly insults him by not selling Wick's awesome car, Iosef retaliates by coming to Wick's house, beating him up and killing his dog. This action sparks a series of bloody gun battles as Wick pursues Iosef through gangsters on a violent path for revenge.

Iosef's father, Viggo (Michael Nyqvist) is the head of the Russian mob and seeks to protect his son from the Boogeyman that is John Wick. He hires a former colleague of Wick's Marcus (Willem Dafoe) to take him out. Wick's path leads him to an exclusive assassin hotel where there are rules to not do business inside the walls and hints at a greater world of assassins.

Check out more of this review and others at swilliky.com

title: Ya, I'm thinking' I'm back.
review: I seriously can not wait to watch the sequel for this. There are so many things I love about this film, I don't know where to start. I love how this movie came out of nowhere and Just kicked everyone in the backside. Reeves is intense and you can just tell he is loving every minute of it. The world building is an extra bonus. The only thing I didn't like about the film is the final fight scene. Other then that, hats off and great times for all. The film is about the son of a mega boss killing the dog of Keanu Reeves and Reeves taking vengeance. This movie has the action, moves along great. The dialogue is the magic behind it all. Keanu Reeves is such an underrated actor because he does action flicks people love to watch. I'm just happy to see him owning his craft.

title: Hard hitting action and fun
review: Imagine that your entire family was wiped out killed one by one and all that is left in your life is a puppy and someone kills the puppy well that is the story of our friend John here he will stop at nothing to figure out who killed his best friend the dog this movie is a lot of fun to the core action and suspense packed with thrills I highly recommend seeing the movie if you have a strong appitite for a action packed fun thrill ride kinda movie or if you are looking for a good time i suggest that you watch it yes the violence in the movie is strong and brutal at times but it is still a winner watch it you will not be disappointed that you did

title: Solid 7 Review
review:
I wanted to give you a quick review of this film, and I do recommend it if you like hit-man movies. This movie is about a hit-man who has gone into a peaceful lifestyle and stopped his work as 'retired' until he is forced back into work after becoming involved with the Russian mafia. It is a great spin of a story taking place in New York City, and has fantasy aspects that you may enjoy if you are a fan of for example, Hit-man Agent 47 movie / video game.

I watched this with low expectancy, having Keanu Reeves as my 2nd to most favorite actor of 2017, I decided I wanted to see this after new years. Check out this movie #2 coming out in Feburary 2017. I will too.

title: The Action movie we all deserve
review:
For years, decades, Hollywood tried to shove stupid action movies down our throats.

Every bullet misses, punches aren't heavy at all, and the hero aaaaalways has to say something.

John Wick, featuring the fantastic, amazing, wonderful Keanu Reeves, is showing Hollywood how it's supposed to be done. In a 100 minutes long movie, which is actually rather short for today's trends, the movie makes us feel like John feels, hate like John hates, and cheer as John kills. It's one of the few non-superhero action movies, that wives and husbands can watch together, and completely enjoy it.

While respecting the "The Heroes Story" timeline, John Wick mixes it up, and shows us all that all it takes to create a bad-ass Action hero and a great action movie (franchise).

Shoot, kill, repeat. No senseless talking, explaining, dramatizing. John Wick does exactly what every single one of us watchers would want to do in his situation.

Great movie, great fun, awesome Keanu.

The only thing that could improve the movie would be Brendan Fraser.

title: Not as dark as some revenge movies but non stop action and keanu doesn't get it all his own way
review:
I missed the very beginning but soon caught up when dad asks son, you stole john wicks car and killed his dog? The game of thrones actor clearly never learned his lesson back in the day and should have just presented his nut sack on a plate to John wick and said sorry. As it was, he didn't take his error of judgement seriously and we get to enjoy a retired hit man regain his touch.

A lot of dead bodies, usually clinical, believable action if you believe in trained man against oafish clumsy boys.

Few facial expressions, little humour, it works, cause who really cracks jokes when fighting for your life or dusting yourself down after being given a good beating, which John wick receives quite a lot actually.

More grown up than die hard, not as dark as the Mel Gibson, "I just want my 70000 dollars" movie. Great cameos in there too during a good action shoot em up hour and a half

title: Excellent action, average acting, bad story
review:
I have ambivalent feelings after watching this movie. This is a stylish action film, where the actions are so cool and believable, and sometimes even too realistic. However, the acting of the supporting roles' actors is simplistic, we have seen thousands of such acting instances in average Hollywood movies. The story is bad. I understand the the movie is meant to be an action movie for having fun time, but sometimes the story is so bad that I felt uncomfortable on my coach.

One interesting fact. There seems to be a cinematographic novelty in this film with regard to fights: The full scale mixture of martial arts and gun fight. This was what I was long waiting for, because in reality this is what will happen if we have a well-trained hit man. Good job!

title: This is a magic carpet ride
review:
I was concerned this will be another dull same old same old movie.

But it wasn't.

This is a great action movie that creates a new superhero assassin. It pulls you in emotionally and then kicks the holly out of the baddies. I love it!

There is very few words spoken in the movie, but it achieves something incredibly entertaining. The magic of the Continental and the sophistication of the secret world combines with the hardcore grip of a pure action adventure.

The director and writers should be commended for creating a masterpiece that other recent superhero movies can just aspire to.

title: Very smooth
review:
I like action movies, although fight scenes usually bore me a little. Most scenes in this movie however, are very smooth. The men in suits make things look more sophisticated, the magnificent choreography is almost graceful. All in all, the fight scenes are beautiful and fascinating to watch.

The use of Russian is cool, gives the whole thing a rough edge. I love the subtitles, they have put in so much work to get that just right! The accentuated words make you 'hear' what words are stressed, even if you don't speak Russian.

The music is excellent. Strong, meticulous with a rough edge. Perfect for this movie.

The story is compelling, from the first second you're drawn in. I'm very curious for the sequel, Chapter 2!

title: Keanu Reeves kills 150 people and it's pretty cool to watch
review:
Read a review calling it "kinetic". That's pretty much it. Good guy seeks revenge on bad guy and his minions, plot is thin so it's all about style, and this does a pretty darn good job considering just how hollow and clichéd the story is.

Actually good soundtrack, good taste in music and a score fairly diverse but always coherent with the scenes. The dialog gets a bit too stereotypical on occasion but there's some good fun there, and there's enough in the film to make it a relevant watch without completely despairing as you'd think from such an utterly action-oriented production.

The cinematography is actually quite good and visually, this movie deserves to be seen in high definition.

It's really pretty good for how little there is to work with. 6.5/10.

title: Most bad-ass thing I've seen
review:
This movie is a absolute banger! From the top notch acting all the way to the simplistic but greatly executed story - this movie is amazing and thrilling in every sense of the word. And not just as a thriller but as a film. It may be "just" a revenge angle but you totally get the main characters motives and get behind him quickly. Everybody who wants a great thriller that is entertaining and stylistic from beginning to end.. this is your movie. It's worth it for the fight scenes alone.

To say more about the look and sound of this movie: It looks suspenseful and fascinating. Kinda like a comic movie. This film also has a great score and some perfectly fitting songs in it like "Killing Strangers" from Marilyn Manson which fits the story very much.

So like I said, this is worth your time I think. Enjoy.

title: Addictive action
review: I do not get tired of watching this movie...the main character has a skill set that is powerful and compelling. The action, gunfu, segments are flawless and clearly resulted from very professional choreography. If you are into firearms you will want to watch this over and over. The sequence that featured the KelTech KSG shotgun made me go out and get one...it is a compact, powerful and lethal weapon for home defense. The underworld depicted, the Continental, the Red Circle were very believable although you know that they could not exist and I enjoyed seeing what dinner reservations turned into and how they used gold coins as their own private currency...very creative.

title: Awesome movie
review:
My favorite movie of the year

The truth is that John Wick is just a messy third act away from being a completely perfect film but I don't think any less of this material, nor the intent. And that's all thanks to a group of filmmakers with the simple gusto to actually make a dog revenge movie. But that just becomes our waypoint into a world full of weirdo hit-man hotels, tactical double tap-laden action, and a populace filled with nothing but goofy reverence for Keanu's pulp menace (where's he's really at his best).

So yeah, this one is absolutely awesome.

title: Tight plot, smooth execution, stylish cinematic
review: Wow. Watching this is so satisfying. A straight to the point film from beginning to end, no moment is wasted and I loved every single second of this film. Stylistically, the film is carried out beautifully. The action sequences are intense. The idea of this underground world based in the Continental, use specific gold coin currency, and their special waste disposal service is as intriguing as John Wick the character himself. What surprised me the most was also how funny the dialogues are when you least expects it from Viggo and John Wick. This is easily my favorite action movie of all time. I wish the sequel is about Wick's backstory on how he left Viggo.

title: Don't mess with a guys dog
review:
Pretty sure this is how everyone would imagine we would react if someone messed with our dog. Oh and our wive's as well!

Okay with that being said this was an excellent movie, the best action I have seen Keanu do since the Matrix movies.

The story is good enough to hold your interest as well.

I rated it excellent because I had low expectations for this movie and they were blown away. However, if I saw this movie in the theater I am not sure my rating/review would be the same. It is one of those types of movies.

Enjoy then prepare for the sequel.

title: Good, but could have been great
review: If you start a drinking game where everyone takes a shot whenever someone in John Wick gets shot in the face, there's a good chance at least one of you will be admitted to the ER with acute alcohol intoxication. I see this film as an opportunity missed. Keanu looks amazing at 50 and definitely carries the sad action antihero role well. The technical aspects of this film are excellent. The action sequences flow beautifully in their cartoonish brutality, but the film falls short in the execution of the script. A story this silly should not take itself so seriously, if only they had more fun with the ludicrous plot and dialogue. I mean, you've got the mayhem guy from the Allstate insurance commercials playing a bad-guy executive secretary, surely that's good for a joke somewhere? An 80's action movie in 2014 needs a little more effort to make me laugh with it rather than at it. I'd only recommend it if you are willing to turn your brain off for a couple of hours and enjoy the ride.

title: Quite good!
review:
Now, this is an action film ! From the beginning ( well, not actually first 10 minutes or so, but....) to the end is full of action, interesting plots and scenes and really keeps you entertained!

I must say that I have not seen in a long time a better action movie! Keanu is perfect in the role! All other actors are too. The story is great. The moving of the film/plot is done perfectly. All those secret society mafia agents living by the rule are great! There is really nothing that you can say is bad about the movie.

The language they use...I thought it was Romanian almost entire film. But when they mentioned the Russian church, I figured out it must be Russian.

Loved the ending of the film. Most of the films have some kind of a bad ending and that can ruin all, but this one is perfect!

My favorite part/scene: when those 'cleaners' come to his house after the first shooting and wrap those dead bodies like mummies ! Man, that was something!

Nine from me. Don't know exactly why it is not ten, but 9.50 would be more exact.

title: What Taken was for Liam Neeson....John Wick is for Keanu Reeves
review:
Is there some sort of rule in Hollywood the once you hit 50+ you join the hit-man club? because if there is i have no complaints if they keep dishing out movies like these.

As you know......Keanu Reeves loses his wife and she gives him a dog so he doesn't cope mourning alone, gangsters rob him and kill his dog and all hell break's loose! The body count and blood in this movie is ridiculous.

Max Payne is what John Wick should of been.....but Keanu Reeves and co have simply made it better, the action and the booming soundtrack is fantastic!. Say what you want about Keanu Reeves being wooden but i've always enjoyed his movies....this is more of a resurgence for him as it was for Liam Neeson in Taken.

Overall Score 8/10

title: Quick review (pros/cons)
review:
To start off, the bad points of the movie: half of the actors including the main villain felt average or even below average acting skill. In some places the effects were easily noticeable (sometimes terrible). And last but not least the move felt cheesy, it felt like they try to paint this super powerful image of the main character (just like internet does with Chuck Norris).

Now with the good points: as I mentioned half of the cast was pretty bad, but Keanu Reeves was really good, I also liked Willem Dafoe, Ian McShane, John Leguizamo Daniel Bernhardt and Clarke Peters. Some of them had so little screen time, but when they did, it felt so refreshing to see an interesting character after the sea of average. And obviously the most important thing is the stunts: a lot of the time they were impressive and kept me on my toes.

All in all, John Wick is a pretty good action movie. I wouldn't give 7 if it wasn't for Keanu. I feel like he's a good actor and he deserves a good movie once again (after the matrix trilogy), but this wasn't it. I'll keep my fingers crossed for you, Keanu!

title: Regarding Movie of John Wick
review: Keanu Reeves is an outstanding actor in this movie and i have always loved his acting he really is a talented person and i must say this movie is a must watch to everyone out there with an interesting story title. how he misses his wife after she dies and how he receives a pet puppy dog as a present from his dead wife is a really interesting storyline and when the Gang of thugs of a known businessman's son comes and takes everything from him. it is the time to unleash the beast in him and for them to pay the price for the damage they did. the directory and the person who did write the script did a great job. hard to find such meaningful movies these days when all these fantasy movies comes out.Great Movie. No more words to describe it.

title: fairy well done film
review:
Okay so I finally took the chance in watching John Wick even after all of the negative reviews that are everywhere, good thing is those negative reviews are BS. Only thing I can agree with in the negative reviews is that Keanu Reeves is not the best actor for this genre but he did do a fair job. Keanu done well in the Matrix but as for action films he just doesn't fit that part especially a film like John Wick where he is the top assassin.

So after watching the film I see it is exactly what anyone would expect to see, the story was good and the acting was fair. The film style and the graphics were great, this is a fairly put together film. John Wick sheds light for many with the "what would you do in such a situation"? Check the film out and stop listening to those BS reviews out there, most of those bad and good reviews are Bought Reviews.

title: Well come back Keanu Reeves
review:
First, I hesitated to buy the DVD John Wick cause of the so many bloody bullets fallen in this thriller. So you are warned. Then, when I read the reviews here I thought to give it a chance. Also my friends who watched it recommended to check it out. In fact I don't regret. It's a clear revenge story à la Rambo. I was never bored. The pace is fast and the film has been cut to a perfect running time of 97 minutes. Keanu Reeves looked cool and credibly in the real fight scenes.

With John Wick he succeeded no doubt in an unexpected comeback. I hope to see him soon in a sequel.

7/10

title: The bogeyman is back!
review:
I am glad to see that Reeves has returned back to action films as I think he is one of the best -together with Tom Crouz- in this kind of kick-ass films.

I found the acting of Reeves as playing Mr. John Wick, was (again) great. Reeves has class, -even with few some extra kg- and I like it.

But the plot was the absolute zero! It was like that...

  • Knock knock - Who is there? - The bogeyman. - The bogeyman who? - The bogeyman wanna beat to death your dog-killer son.


I think the public would appreciate something more than this simplistic plot. I can't compare that film with Matrix or Constantine... But in any case there are some very good action scenes here so it worths watching it one time, and that's it.

title: Common Sense-U don't mess with Keanu Reeves!!!!
review:
John Wick is a 2014 American action thriller film directed by Chad Stahelski and David Leitch. Starring Keanu Reeves, Michael Nyqvist, Alfie Allen, Adrianne Palicki, Bridget Moynahan, Dean Winters, Ian McShane, John Leguizamo, and Willem Dafoe, the film stars Reeves as John Wick.

Legendary assassin John Wick (Keanu Reeves) retired from his violent career after marrying the love of his life. Her sudden death leaves John in deep mourning. When sadistic mobster Iosef Tarasov (Alfie Allen) and his thugs steal John's prized car and kill the puppy that was a last gift from his wife, John unleashes the remorseless killing machine within and seeks vengeance. Meanwhile, Iosef's father (Michael Nyqvist) -- John's former colleague -- puts a huge bounty on John's head.

title: A good movie
review:
After all these years, though, he's still quintessentially Keanu. He radiates a Zen-like calm which makes him simultaneously elusive and irresistible, especially in the face of great mayhem. There's still a boyish quality to his face but it belies the wisdom of his years. He's smarter than he looks but he's in no great hurry to go out of his way to prove it to you–at least, not on screen.

A character like John Wick is right because it allows him to be coolly, almost mythically confident, yet deliver an amusing, deadpan one-liner with detached precision. But when the time comes–and it comes often in "John Wick"–he can deliver with a graceful yet powerful physicality.

title: John wick- Samurai Jack 2.0
review:
John wick is a 21st century gift to viewers who were tired of seeing action movies with poor story, shallow plot & CGI. John wick is a grand piece of action which has bullets ( like lot of bullets), great dialog, cool 80's reference & few funny moments which are missing in today's action movies. keanu reeves look was amazing & the fight choreography reminds me of movies like collateral & the even the influence of martial art movies are quite visible. The villein is quite strong great dialog, good sets & different languages.

For all the movie action gun battle lovers, John wick is a great piece of action which would surly take your adrenaline level to the top.

P.S- If a John wick prequel is made, it would be great to see how & why john wick is so bad ass.

5 star for this amazing movie.

title: One dimensional, but entertaining.
review:
As mentioned by many, and as may have been guessed by reading the short description, the conflict in the movie is very one dimensional.

You do, however, get a subtle glimpse into a complex world left behind, and surprisingly convincing action scenes (well, the whole movie was really just one action scene).

You can count the bullets fired, and he runs out of bullets as you would expect. He doesn't have super-human abilities, he does well, but not magically. His minor character development presents a person who you would believe could be real and who would respond the way he does in the film - though you don't really get to fully understand that until later.

Best part (for me) is that consequences of actions are shown. I can't really explain that more without adding spoilers... so I won't, but by the end of the film it should make sense.

Also, you can see a camera man or stage hand in one of the many many many many fight scenes - which is always a bonus.

title: "There's no rhyme or reason to this life."
review: From my perspective there's only one reason to watch a picture like this, and that's to simply escape reality altogether and get your vicarious thrills through the impossible escapades of the film's titled hero. That's not meant to be a put down, I enjoy these flicks myself when I'm in the right frame of mind, but I don't pretend they're anything more than over the top, shoot 'em up action as they go for the proverbial gusto. I must have lost track of Keanu Reeves' career there for a while because I never would have considered him to be the kind of action hero the picture calls for here at the age of fifty. The role calls for a fair amount of athleticism and Reeves pulls out all the stops. Sometimes if I'm alert enough I'll start taking a body count when the carnage begins but with this one I got distracted by the waste disposal crew accepting their dinner reservations. Setting the torch to Viggo's (Michael Nyqvist) private stash was the icing on the cake for this viewer, drawing me to the conclusion that the Russian mobster would have been a whole lot better off offering the four million dollars to John Wick to just go away.

title: XKCD explains it best
review:
Some people get this movie, others don't.

XKCD explains it best:

"Just once I want a real action movie. 30 seconds of exposition followed by a perfect 90-minute action scene with a huge budget, a good choreographer and a great director, and they should center it around some character we already know, someone we will never get tired of watching.

Coming this Summer, Keanu Reeves beats up everyone!"

https://xkcd.com/311/

Still waiting for the River Tam version

title: The action makes this worth a look
review:
I have to make a confession before getting into this movie - I normally can't stand Keanu Reeves. Apart from playing a likable goofball in the "Bill & Ted" films and an okay performance in "The Matrix", I don't think he's a particularly good actor. Which is the main reason why I avoided this movie when it played in theaters. I decided to give it a look after hearing several positive reviews of it and after finding a copy I could check out for free from my local library.

After watching it, I am glad that I took a chance. For starters, Reeves gives an adequate performance. It certainly helps that he doesn't have a huge amount of dialogue, but what he is given he does deliver acceptably. However, he does a bravo job when it comes to the physical part of the role - he throws himself into the action, coming across both as a spectacular skilled foe while at the same time not coming across as outlandishly fancy - I could believe a man could be skilled enough to do everything he did. (It also helps that he gets wounded and hurt along the way, which prevents him from becoming unbelievably and annoyingly perfect.)

While I'm on the subject of action, kudos has to also go to director Chad Stahelsk for staging it successfully again and again. The gun fights and martial arts are spectacular. Praise has to also go to him for keeping the movie moving speedily along without any boring bits despite there not being a terrible amount of plot... and for the fact that the little plot there is will be familiar to many viewers.

I see they are making a sequel to this movie. If both Reeves and Stahelsk return, I'll definitely be seeing it.

title: Overall John Wick is a satisfying action movie, but don't watch it for anything but a good time.
review: John Wick is a dark and explosive action hit! Now before you commit to watching this movie you must be in the mood for over-the-top, unrealistic, action violence . If that is what you are looking for then John Wick provides in every area. The movie revolves around a retired hit-man who recently dropped out of the game to stay at home with his wife. After a series of unsettling events John is thrown back into the world of underground mobsters and assassins as he seeks revenge against the men who took all he had left. The story is not great but provides enough sway to convince you to cheer for Wick throughout the movie as he kills dozens of Russian mobsters. Keanu Reeves performance is sub-par as his character rarely speaks and shows little to no emotion, but since he is a world class assassin this may fit his character perfectly. The fight scenes are entertaining and the hand-hand combat competes with that of the Bourne series, but the story is not as compelling and also not as confusing.Overall John Wick is a satisfying action movie, but don't watch it for anything but a good time.

title: cool idea, but lead miscast
review:
Liam Neeson must have been busy, so the director got Keanu Reeves to take his place. Problem is Reeves isn't known for playing this type of character and took away something from the film.

However, since the film has got a cool plot to it, it's still pretty good even with Reeves as the lead. Reeves plays John Wick, the deadliest hit-man ever, that just so happens to be retired because he fell in love. Well, his wife died and left him a puppy. He encounters some punk Russian kid that wants his ride. Later the kid shows up, takes the ride, kills the dog, and beats up John. Well, he messed with the wrong guy. It just so happens the kid's mob dad was the guy John used to work for and now he wants revenge.

What's cool in the movie is the whole hit-man code speech, the Continental hotel (where one doesn't do business), paying with these gold coins, and making a dinner reservation. The ending is where the film falls apart and just becomes another action flick with the "hero" out to get the final bad guy. It was rather silly, but the first 80 minutes was really good.

FINAL VERDICT: Check it out, good story for action fans.

title: Keanu needs a payday.
review:
Heh, so that's what it looks like when Matrix and Equilibrium have unprotected relationship. Sadly, if the two movies above were filled not only with... extremely brilliant scenes for the technology of the time, but also quite deep and meaningful plot - John Wick seems to be a pretty one-sided coin.

He lost his dearly beloved, he got mugged, that's all the premise you need. Though I do admit that Viggo's exposition was impressive, some background would be nice.

Granted all the plot unravellings, I don't understand why would he hang up Viggo's call. Both John and Viggo know better, and instead of going on some mad rampage, a simpler fate could've been arranged. Much simpler. Or it could end the same, but it would at least look plausible.

Red Circle encounter is laughable. Beautiful, obviously, until he stares at his desired victim and just lets him run away. I first thought he wants the usual: suffering, torture etc. But apparently he never needed it, so why not end the movie halfway through if there was a chance?

All the side characters are merely plot devices. Female assassin? Has to explain what the management was. Marcus? Deus ex machina.

Yosef's death could probably only rival Talia Al'ghoul's. Home siege, Red Circle, Car scene... all these great performances, yet the very antagonist of this movie was supposed to be hidden in impenetrable fortress, but... Snipe here, snipe there, done. Seriously?

The list can continue, but the point is that very often the suspension of disbelief is raised, even if you really want to keep it.

And, of course, I can't help but stand in line with every Russian who was severely offended by this movie. Now, I know that between Italian and Russian mafia - these nations shouldn't really be surprised when their people are slaughtered, and I would never imagine that Hollywood would ever get Russian actors. But that song? The lullaby? I know russians are a sick nation firsthand, but not even the craziest of us would sing a "lullaby" in a nightclub in a bath with half naked women.

I feel that giving the movie 7\10 is a very generous gift. If not for Wick and Viggo's performance - 5\10 would've been the right place. Aka - a movie that really isn't remotely good, but is at least worth looking for the some thrills. But hey, I can play as John Wick now, he is played by ol' good Neo and there was plenty of gun fu. Who can resist that?

title: Fun Popcorn Movie...
review:
This film surprised me...Because I didn't expect it to be so much fun...When I first saw the trailer for this film...I figured it was just going to be this really over the top action movie that will certainly be loved by animal rights activist...

What I didn't expect was for the main character, that being John Wick, to have so many layers...Nowadays, many action films tend to lean toward the protagonist being this icy and remorseless human being who wouldn't show any expressions even if he stepped on a nail...

But John Wick didn't do that...He had a difficult past, he cried when he was sad, he loved his car and he showed a great deal of affection to his dog...

The story had a few plot holes and was a bit choppy and silly from time to time...But at least the movie had substance...This is one of those films where there is no need to be concerned about character development, a well written story, or Oscar-caliber performances...

This is a good old fashioned popcorn movie to which the audience can simply kick back, relax, and have a good time...And that's all there is too it...

title: A decent thriller with undefined motives
review: Keanu Reeves stars as the badass hit-man who happens to kill dozens of people in order to avenge the death of his dog that was gifted by his recently deceased wife. The action is slick and in some ways is reminiscent of Taken in the manner of the deaths. Throughout the movie, the motive behind the action of John Wick is not clear. He basically does all the killings in order to take revenge for his dog and his stolen car. It does not make much sense which is why it is hard to understand what the screenwriters were thinking while writing. The performances of Keanu Reeves is understated and a tad bit disappointing. The short runtime makes it easy to watch but the absurd plot will not please the people who are looking for a smart, ingenious thriller. Please leave your brains at home before watching this movie.

title: So apparently it's not supposed to be a comedy.
review:
I mean, cmon. Cmon, movie. You are a fun movie, stop being so grim about things. You had great action, great cinematography, appropriate (!) casting of Keeanu Reeves as that plain faced gun-Christ being all stupid and honorable, goofy Russians, more goofy Russians, terminal amounts of goofy Russians, that scene with the policeman. It's fun. Even some Keanu moping was appropriate.

But why did you have to kill a puppy, movie. Killing puppies is not fun, movie. It's anti-fun. If you have a character kill a puppy, a shot in the head won't be enough closure. And so it wasn't. And the movie was made significantly less fun by it.

On the bright side, I kinda now like Ramsay a bit more.

title: the most happening movie of 2014.
review: John Wick is not just another action packed train its a roller coaster and in which i happily enjoyed my ride. you have a easy opening sequence like going up in a roller coaster but just minutes into it the ride starts with endless ups and downs for you to cheer. then there is acting of the cast each one did their role perfectly and effectively and the cast is great from Neo to goblin to Theon Greyjoy we have a variety of good actors. And then again after one last upside down the movie flats outs like at the end of roller coaster ride. This movie will again remind you a big budget is not important for big thrills. THIS IS A ROLLER COASTER RIDE YOU SHOULD TRY ONE TIME.

title: Surprisingly Fun Movie!
review:
So why watch John Wick? I asked myself that same question when the wife and I got a free Red-Box code and she had heard good things about this movie and wanted to watch it, while I on the other hand not being a big fan of Keanu Reeves originally wanted no part in it, but decided that as long as we were watching for free then I couldn't complain too much... and there was absolutely nothing to complain about. I loved this movie!

The draw to this movie is of course the non-stop heart-pounding action. The plot wasn't complicated, and there was a lot of this universe left unexplained, but I felt that actually added to the movie: they didn't have to get into ever painstaking detail of who John Wick was, because the bad guys knew who he was, and they were terrified of him, that was really all you needed to know.

Like my summary says: This was just a surprisingly fun movie. Just sit back, don't let your brain think too hard about the "journey", and just enjoy the ride.

title: Wick Equalized
review:
I suppose for me the idea of John Wick was something like 'Falling Down' but without the social comments and instead of an ordinary guy pushed over the edge, here the protagonist is a retired hit-man.

Needless to say, the entire plot is adequately summed up in the trailer and if you like movies that set out to entertain in a simple way, the comic book logic and emphasis on stunts and action here will be right up your alley. From my viewpoint, I hesitate to say Reeves carries this movie to a certain extent, but I don't want to take too much away from the rest of the cast, though some like Palicki aren't given much of a chance to demonstrate their full range of talents or have a strong impact on the proceedings for lack of time on screen. Nyqvist gives an interesting performance but is fighting against a particularly weak script even by action movie standards, and his Russian Mob Boss character often comes off as somewhat of an imbecile, even if there are deliberate attempts at humor peppered in.

Overall, Reeves is appealing and inherently sympathetic with a sombre low-key performance sort of reminiscent of what he did in 'The Watcher'. Notably his physical work with regards to the action is commendable, but in my opinion it is a shame it was not applied to a movie with a slightly stronger script and direction, when compared with a movie that strives for similar goals like 'The Equalizer' which lacked those deficiencies and made for a more well- rounded and engaging viewing experience.

Worth watching, could of been better, so

** out of ****

title: Better than expected
review:
Under normal circumstances I wouldn't have seen John Wick. I'm not a big fan of action thrillers and Keanu Reeves hasn't been my favourite actor either. The selection of movies was pretty limited at the theatres, so decided to give John Wick a chance.

Have to confess that I was pleasantly surprised by the film and enjoyed it much more than expected. In particular Keanu Reeves as John Wick was very good. In the past the only roles that he ever looked comfortable and appropriate in were the characters who looked somewhat bewildered about what was going on. The first Matrix film in particular played to his strengths whereas the follow ups didn't convince as he was supposed to be a stronger character. There is no doubt that he pulls this off in John Wick, so will not be quite as snooty about Keanu in the future! The film itself is quite stylish and somewhat similar to Sin City in terms of style. Personally I found the on screen comments quite annoying, but the film is reasonably written in terms of screenplay. If you are a fan of action thrillers and/or Keanu Reeves I'm quite sure you'll really enjoy this movie.

title: Over The Top Enjoyable Actioner
review:
A retired hit-man gives up his criminal lifestyle due to personal tragedy . When the Russian mob steal his car and kill his puppy he decides to go in a revenge mission

And that's that as far as inciting incident and plot line goes in this modern film noir/action thriller . Despite having a painfully over familiar story that you've seen countless times JOHN WICK is far more thoroughly enjoyable than it has any right to be . The fact that it stars Keanu Reeves as Keanu Reeves action hero should put you or any other rational intelligent off the film but he's actually quite good in this . Okay he's basically choreographing all the same moves as he learned in THE MATRIX but thankfully Reeves doesn't have to do much involving the skill of acting - why break the habit of a life time ? - but as a no holds barred enjoyably mean thriller with its tongue firmly in cheek " Sorry to disturb you Mister Wick but we've had a complaint about the noise" it's very entertaining . If you want to find out how this movie could have been check out the horrible mess that is SMOKIN' ACES which has a not too dissimilar plot

title: Aesthetically beaufitul but an overall clumsy movie
review: I do not understand why this movie has that many good reviews. Sure, it has some good things going for it (choreography, some characters, nice action scenes, interesting places) but that's it. The whole plot (especially the first 20 minutes) happens too fast for the audience to even feel some sympathy for Wick. Dialogs are clumsy, some situations are ridiculous (and i do not mean the fight scenes, those i can cope with), the flow is just...weird. Oh and LOTS of clichés, really predictable characters with no real personality, everyone is kinda hollow and simple. I don't know, maybe it was not supposed to be taken seriously but it sure does not feel like a light hearted action film.

title: Far too much cheap, point-blank killing for this to be a really good movie.
review:
OK, I know it is a movie, a complete work of fiction, I know actors didn't really die. But this kind of movie glorifies point-blank execution killing justified because the guys being killed work for a Russian mafia in New York. But it still cheapens life and we simply have too much of that in our movies.

In general I like Keanu Reeves and I like his character here, John Wick, who formerly worked as a hit man for the same Russian gang that he has to turn against. He had successfully gotten out, "retired", and had a life with his loving wife. But she had a terminal illness and she died.

Still in grief, he gets a delivery at home, it is a cute puppy that his wife had arranged to be delivered right after her death, so he would have a companion and he could remember her.

Stopped for gasoline in his beautiful 1969 Mustang, puppy in the front seat, a guy walks up and asks "How much?" Shocked Wick simply says it is not for sale. The man says something rude in Russian then is shocked when Wick answers him, in Russian.

That night the dog alerts and Wick gets up to find three men in his house, they must have looked up his address from the Mustang's license plate. They beat him mercilessly, killed his dog, and stole his Mustang. (Sounds like an old western movie, doesn't it?)

Well this "guy" is the frivolous son of the Russian gang leader, and when the dad, Michael Nyqvist as Viggo Tarasov, finds out his son stole John Wick's car, and killed his dog, he knew Wick would hunt all of them down. Which is what he does, and that is mostly what the movie is about.

The other good role is Willem Dafoe as fellow hit-man Marcus, who appears to accept a $4 Million job to kill John Wick, but instead he ends up helping him.

This is just a plain shoot and kill revenge movie, and it could have been so much better but I suppose this is what appeals to movie- goers nowadays.

title: Well-executed (ha ha) and fun to watch but cliché-laden
review:
I really struggled to choose a rating for this movie. Lots of good, lots of bad.

Good:

  • Keanu does a great job. Just the right mix of believable and unbelievable.


  • Really excellent directing and cinematography. It's really easy in these kinds of films for the action scenes to be hard to follow, but these are great. No surprise this crew were associated with The Matrix, whose action scenes were similarly clean.


  • A few nice little surprises, but not enough of them.


Bad (spoilers here):

  • Oh lord, the clichés. First, the entire premise: badass hit-man forced out of retirement to avenge a wrong done to him. Russian mob boss with brash dumbass son. Obligatory stash of weapons and money sealed under concrete floor. Old friend who appears to have turned on our hero but saves his bacon at a couple of crucial moments. Climactic fight with the main bad guy in which they toss aside their guns and fight hand to hand.


  • That wrong done to him? Killing his dog and stealing his car. Seriously? I get the sentiment behind the dog and his dead wife and all, but still I was reminded of the bit in Last Action Hero about how they killed his favorite second cousin or whatever.


If this was the first movie you'd ever seen in this genre, it would be totally amazing. As it is, I kept seeing a lot of things I'd seen before and not enough things that I hadn't. Those things were really well done, but that doesn't make up for them being horribly unoriginal.

If you can quiet your brain enough to just watch and enjoy, this is worth seeing. Just don't expect to see much that is new.

title: John Wick - Best Video Game Ever???
review: John Wick is an awesome video game and one of the best third-person shooters I've ever played with incredible groundbreaking graphics, a handsome lead character to control in John Wick, and a more clever story premise than you might realize. What's that? John Wick is a movie? John Wick is a movie. John Wick, is a movie. That explains why I was so good. No wonder. John Wick has a video game plot, video game action, a video game reality, a video game mentality, video game art, lighting and text, and a bunch of random dudes popping out out of nowhere getting shot one by one like they're in some video game or something. Keanu Reeves kicks serious ass as John Wick and I laugh at the thought of people who don't think he's a good actor. Reeves is John Wick. Keanu Reeves is really cool. John Wick is really uncool. I love puppies as much as the next guy but not as much as John Wick apparently. John Wick's 75 man kill count speaks volumes. John Wick has a genius story premise with well choreographed and very well shot stylish action that is fun but not that suspenseful. John Wick almost has too much pointless violence but they did mess with his puppy and it is such a pure action film.

title: Slick shoot em up with stylish visuals but anorexic plot.
review:
Of its genre, a quite entertaining if ultimately absurd way to spend a couple of hours of your life. Other posters have gone into the plot discrepancies before and considering there isn't really what you could call a plot then these are major flaws. The only slightly interesting plot element is the Continental hotel, a hotel for hit men (and hitwomen) where psychopathic killers can be assured a good nights sleep without fear of being attacked by other psychopathic killers. Perhaps there is a hole in the market for that sort of thing....

But if you are able to overlook the films flaws you will find much to like here. It is slickly and stylishly shot, the action sequences( of which there are many )are well paced and choreographed in a style which borrows heavily from MMA, its has a strong supporting cast and even Keanu Reeves looks convincing.

There is a time and a place for this sort of film and it does what it sets out to do with a degree of flair, and I for one wouldn't mind seeing more of John Wick.

title: One Time Watch
review: Totally insane movie with awesome fights. Keanu delivers a terrific performance. The story line is very weak. But the characterization of the hero is Stunning. The other characters have limited screen space. Full credits to the stunt master. John Wick is a killer, ghost man, he can kill three men armed only with a pencil, but somehow manages to overlook a couple of brainless thugs hack into his house, lets them beat the crap out of himself, kill his dog and steal his car. John Wick is so famous that even the policeman, the bartenders, the mafia, all the town know him, but the son of a mafia boss for some reason does not even hear about him! The funniest thing in the movie is The hero kills hundreds of gangsters, the mafia boss and his son just for a stupid dog. This movie should have been titled "A man rises for a Dog".

title: Just another OK action movie !
review: Just another action movie with an OK script, good cast, OK acting, nothing but a lot of action, really liked the John Wick character by Keanu Reeves and his past, liked the parts where he speaks Russian, but a lot of scenes are just so much cliché,jumping out of the car in the last second, dodge a bullet in the last second, things that you see in all of other OK movies out there, i thing that they had all the potential to make a great movie but turns out to be just OK, Dafoe could had been used in a way better way than what he was,well i think it will be just another action movie that nobody will remember in an near future .

title: tgchan says YES! / www.tgchan.pl
review:
7.2/10 from 94,363 users, not bad huh? I honestly hope it's a solid 7. I really have a weakness for Keanu Reeves and some of his films are one of my favourites. The last one I have watched was the 47 Ronin (2013) and hated it!

6 minutes – it's dark and gloomy, I already love it!

8 minutes – and they already want me to make cry I have a goodie good feelings about it

15 minutes – holy F! A reason to start the action going on is dumb as it gets but damn! Now that will justify everything that he's going to make to the bad guys

26 minutes- now that's how you build up the tension and atmosphere, amazing work!!! I want see more!

29 minutes – nice action ruined by CGI blood for F sake why oh why they can't stick to the 90's blood effects They were realistic and looked amazing and this craps is plain rubbish

33 minutes – the film has a big BAD-ASS, written all over it! Great cast (Keanu Reeves, Willem Dafoe, Ian McShane, Alfie Allen), music, story, action and a bad CGI blood

52 minutes – an amazing mixture of Equilibrium (2002), Léon (1994) and Assassins (1995) and all this with Keanu Reeves! 1h minutes – first lame scene but it was a fight vs a girl, those are always lame

1h 13minues – the action sure as hell looks amazing and there is one after another, all the time

WTF with the ending!? Just wtf It was a direct insult from a director because you can't call it anything else

Nice action film ruined by a terrible ending there is also no story whatsoever. The longer I think about it, the more I am surprised that I liked it let's just leave it here.

tgchan's rating: 6/10

title: The story is nonsense but doesn't means it's not entertaining.
review:
The first 30 minutes is very The Equalizer. I was thinking give up on it, the policeman scene after the home fight changed my mind and scenes like this one actually is the entertaining part of the movie.

I'm not the fan of the story so when the police showed up, I thought John is about to be hunted by both gang and police which is a sign of "you can spend your night better than this".

No, the conversation between John and policeman Jimmy change the tune of the whole story.

Legendary hit-man John Wick is a famous hit-man, a fair hit-man, a man whose reputation is so good even police don't want to bother him. Everyone in the business knows him and almost everyone respected him.

With this idea in mind, the story makes a little sense now. The ridiculous decision that let the gang boss go and killed his son is because his fairness. John's business is always with the dog-killing son. Until gang boss killed his friend.

The idea of continental hotel is interesting too. When hit-man does business, they stay in the hotel so they can reset without worry. The one breaks hotel rule will be executed by the hotel. This alone can make another movie.

In the end, I've to say movie like this one and The Equalizer makes me aware that my time is passing, kids nowadays like movie like such, a lot of action, less story.

title: Some good brain-dead entertainment
review:
This is a nice movie if you are looking for some action without any further sense.

Keanu is the completely overpowered Superman Hero. Killing every guy on his way to revenge. He could have killed easily some times because one of the bad guys obviously was a better fighter and has beaten him up twice but of course Keanu wins at the end. It is like one of the old superhero movies or MacGyver. The bad guys always kill the innocent just for fun right when they get in front of the gun but the main enemy can't be killed when unconscious. No those enemies has to be brought into some prison and even then the bad guys don't kill them immediately no they chat and have a good time and before he gets killed the boss leaves, of course, maybe he is too soft to see his enemy dying. Just as an example of this non-credibility. But still nice brain-dead action.

The storyline is pretty much linear no big surprises some strange decisions and some illogic moments.

title: One with the head-shot!!!
review:
A one time watch movie with lots and lots of head shots!!!...I guess he kills 2 of every 3 gang members with a shot in their head. Same revenge story but this time for a dog!!!...Villain character is not described properly and is portrayed less muscular!!!

The story revolves around a guy who returns to the hell of mafia he once retired for his love. Just before his wife's unexpected death, she gifts him with a puppy which some jerk(Villain's son) kills for his car.

So seeking our for his revenge his melancholy life becomes a action packed hell ride and end up killing everyone and also finds another dog!!!...

title: I don't think is Keanu's best performance. Liam's Taken (the first one ) is better.
review: I didn't buy it. I really like Keanu and some of his movies are really cool and interesting but this one is like an almost complete nonsense for me. Just killings and killings of bad guys because John Wick is sad and there is nothing left for him in this world. Maybe in the killers world they are like that, I don't know. I liked Taken with Liam Neeson better. It had a more credible story. In John Wick, most of the other actors didn't perform well...the son of the big boss is playing as unsustainable as he did in Game of Thrones. I guess, Keanu had to drag all this movie by himself and he wasn't that convincing all the time. Although, there are some scenes where I liked his acting and the fight scenes were pretty realistic, without too much fancy moves and visual effects. I don't want to criticize the work and effort put into this movies. Is just that this movie it's not for me 100% :)

title: Slick Gun Playground
review:
John Wick's quick and slick close range shooting hasn't been developed or observed in this movie making era...so these gun fights were unique and mind blowing.

Keanu Reeves couldn't be any more of a perfect actor to play this character because of his slim body and ninjitsu skills which he carried out from Matrix.

His black shiny suit attire and black mustang suited him and his devotion on getting his gift dog avenged. I liked his dedication and his focus.

Really cool movie!

title: Great Action, Lacking Premise
review:
Going into this film I had high hopes regarding reviews all around. Is Keanu Reeves back? No. Does Keanu Reeves excel in the role of John Wick? Yes, but not many people couldn't. This film lacked in every way possible regarding substance. When I say substance I am referring to the plot, acting, and overall feel.

Yes Keanu Reeves acting was on point, yet everyone else in the movie seemed like straight to DVD actors (trash). Especially the villain Michael Nyqvist. Such a corny performance. If by my taste I was reviewing this movie I would rate it at a 4. Thats a weak 4. But I am going to put myself in a neutral position since action movies aren't my forte.

To conclude, if you are in love with action films please see this movie! You will love it. But if you're more of a Bourne Trilogy kind of action film fan then don't. Story could have been understood by a toddler. Yet this is rated R? What kind of adults just watch movies for explosions and gunfire. Let us relate to a character.

title: Not bad for movie cheap night.
review: Not bad for movie cheap night. My wife and I went to John Wick on cheap Tuesday. John Wick was a good stress release for a bad week. What worked: Reeve's is a physical actor, how he moves, walks, etc and plays the action sequences well. Jason Statham would have been a better John Wick. The revenge plot where mobsters kill John's dog and steals his car resonates with the viewer. What did not work: The action is too fast in a video game style. There was a need for more humor, which the movie Mel Gibson's Payback implemented well. If you are in the market for a revenge flick I recommend Payback over John Wick. John Wick is okay. A VOD movie. Six out of ten.
